titleStmt.title: SII 12.240: original edition by V. Venkatasubba Ayyar
No. 240. (A.R. No. 290 of 1919). ĀVŪR, TIRUVANNAMALAI TALUK, NORTH ARCOT DISTRICT. ON THE SOUTH WALL OF THE CENTRAL SHRINE IN THE RUINED ŚIVA TEMPLE.

summary.p: This is a fragmentary record dated in the 32nd year of the chief. It registers some provision made to the god Tiruvagattīśuramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār for the welfare of Vaṉṉiyanār alias Māṉābharaṇa-Chēdiyarāyar.
The astronomical details given in the inscription are not regular. Śu. prathamā and nakshatra Ārdrā cannot combine in the month of Mēsha.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
A few letters at the beginning are lost. mālaiyumuḻutu muṇanta cittirameḻiperiya[nāṭṭavarumSee SII. Vol. VII. No. 129 and Vol. VIII, No. 198.viyā]Inscribed surface has peeled away.pārikaḷum vaittatu cakalapuvaṉaccakkaravattikaḷ śrīkop Inscribed surface has peeled away.tevarkku yāṇṭu 3 10 2Āvatu meṣa nāyaṟṟu pūrva pakṣattu pratamai yum tiṅkaḷkiḻamaiyum peṟṟa tiruvātiraiyil peṇṇai vaṭakarai
ceṅkuṉṟanāṭṭu cetimaṇṭalattu ĀvūrThe letter r is engraved below the line.uṭaiyār tiruvaInscribed surface has peeled away.katticuram Uṭaiyaṉāyaṉārkku periyanATTavarum Inscribed surface has peeled away.ṉār vaṉṉiyanAr Āṉa māṉāparaṇaccetiyarāyar tirumeṉi kalliyāṇ tirumeniyāka Iṉṉāyaṉār tiruvakatticuramuṭaiyanāThe inscription is left incomplete.
Digital edition of SII 12.240 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
